author: Michel_W
title: A great ending to a great year
review:
Building Experience

Quite good for a small model, with SNOT techniques.

Parts

This set has the most parts of all 2017 mini-models, and they are a great mix of Technic and System parts, including tiles, plates, brackets, sloped and curved bricks. 

The set has two spare parts, round 1x1 plates in black and grey. My daughter found a use for them: the black one went on the round red part at the front, and the grey one inside the cabin, as a light on the ceiling.

Playability

Mini-models are mainly display models. This one can be played with. The wheels turn (due to the use of Technic axle pins) and there is a ball joint at the back (not seen on the photo) to attach a carriage. Unfortunately, like all mini-models, this one is not at minifig scale. The cabin is too narrow and small to even contain a child minifig.

Value for money

It's a giveaway from Lego, no purchase necessary.

Overall

2017 was a great year of colourful, varied and original monthly mini-models. It ends on a high note: the December model is an appropriately seasonal toy steam locomotive in red.

Most mini-models look best from the angle shown on the official Lego photo. From the side or back, they are often quite 'blocky'. Not this model: it looks great from all angles.

Add the amount and variety of parts, the building experience, the playability and extendability (by adding carriages), and you've got the perfect monthly mini-model.

2017 will be a hard act to follow for the MMMB designers...
